snippet: A seven-month conflict-of-interest investigation into the purchase of luxury homes by President Enrique Peña Nieto’s wife and his finance minister from a government contractor found no wrongdoing, Mexico’s comptroller said Friday.
abstract: Virgilio Andrade, Mexico's comptroller, reports that seven-month investigation into real estate dealings of Angelica Rivera, wife of Mexican Pres Enrique Pena Nieto, finds no wrongdoing; conflict-of-interest scandal has cost Pena Nieto politically, and is likely to continue to shadow his administration.
lead_paragraph: A seven-month conflict-of-interest investigation into the purchase of luxury homes by President Enrique Peña Nieto’s wife and his finance minister from a government contractor found no wrongdoing, Mexico’s comptroller said Friday.

headline.main: Investigation Lifts a Cloud Over President of Mexico
headline.print_headline: Investigation Lifts a Cloud Over Leader of Mexico
